content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You are extremely comfortable taking risks and are always ready to embrace new challenges, even if they involve significant uncertainty or potential loss. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

I would choose strategy R_{ } as a human player, given my inclination towards risk-taking and my belief that the potential reward of 45$ per round when both players choose R outweighs the occasional loss of 0$ when they choose B. Over the course of 75 rounds, I anticipate that the higher average payoff from choosing R will result in a more significant total gain compared to choosing B consistently. However, it's essential to acknowledge that there is some uncertainty in this game due to the anonymity of the opponent and the potential for them to adopt different strategies over time. Nonetheless, as a risk-taker, I am willing to take on that uncertainty in pursuit of a potentially higher reward.
You chose R. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 0$. Your opponent's payoff is 40$. Please play the next round.

I would choose strategy R_{ } again, since my goal is to maximize my potential winnings over the long term despite experiencing a loss in the previous round. The strategy of R has a higher average payoff per round (37.5$) compared to choosing B consistently (10$ per round). Therefore, even though I have lost 40$ in the first round by choosing R when my opponent chose B, I still believe that choosing R is the best option moving forward to maximize my overall winnings over 75 rounds. It's important to keep in mind that this game involves some level of uncertainty due to the anonymity of the opponent and their potential strategy changes over time. Nonetheless, as a risk-taker, I remain committed to the R strategy for the next round.
